title: [K-12] Gamification-Based Health Promotion Strategy Design Project for Pediatric Cancer Patients

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and foundational knowledge of game design principles
context.additional_context: Simulation-based design integrating digital/analog game elements using real hospital environment data.

learning_goals: Participants can develop a structured framework for analyzing physical and emotional health factors in pediatric cancer patients.
Participants can design health promotion programs incorporating gamification elements (quests, reward systems, etc.).
Participants can create educational tools that convey medical concepts through multiple-choice questions and a feedback card system.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
